author: Michael Larabel
description: The GNOME Web "Epiphany" web browser is making it easier to toggle WebKit web engine features at run-time...
title: GNOME Web Making It Easier To Toggle WebKit Features

author: Michael Larabel
description: While there was the big 62k lines of code patch from Microsoft merged yesterday to Mesa, separately there was also some code cleaning to remove some previously-deprecated code from the codebase...
title: Mike Blumenkrantz Axes Old Mesa Code: Goodbye Gallium Nine

author: Michael Larabel
description: While the open-source, Rust-based Cloud Hypervisor project was started by Intel as a modern VMM for cloud workloads and focused on security, some Intel CPU features are now bit-rotting. In turn the new Cloud Hypervisor 46 release has deprecated support for Intel Software Guard Extensions (SGX) while even their modern Trust Domain Extensions (TDX) feature is in jeopardy but now with Google engineers set to takeover that code...
title: Cloud Hypervisor 46 Deprecates SGX Support, Google To Take Over TDX Maintenance

author: Michael Larabel
description: KDE developers have been busy addressing bugs within the Plasma 6.4 desktop ahead of its stable release in June. But there has been some last minute feature work to arrive, including support for time-of-day wallpapers with Plasma 6.4...
title: KDE Plasma 6.4 Adds Time-Of-Day Wallpapers, Disabling Adaptive-Sync By Default

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged on Friday for the GCC 16 compiler is better handling of the "-march=" compiler option on RISC-V systems when seeing multiple -march= hits and wanting to specify the RISC-V CPU name for targeting...
title: GCC 16 Lands Better Support For -march= Targeting On RISC-V
